org.microtitan.diffusive.diffuser.restful.resources

Class RestfulDiffuserManagerResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microtitan.diffusive.diffuser.restful.resources.RestfulDiffuserManagerResource

  • public class RestfulDiffuserManagerResource
extends java.lang.Object
    Use the RestfulDiffuserManagerClient for testing this resource against the server, which is either started with the DiffusiveLauncher or the RestfulDiffuserServer.
    Author:
    rob

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  RestfulDiffuserManagerResource.DiffuserEntry
      An entry used by the map of diffusers that contains the Diffuser and the list of class path end-points.
      private static class  RestfulDiffuserManagerResource.DiffuserTask
      Callable task that can be submitted to the ExecutorService to run.

      javax.ws.rs.core.Response execute(javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo, java.lang.String signature, ExecuteDiffuserRequest request)
      Executes the diffuser associated with the specified signature (DiffuserSignature) using the information specified in the ExecuteDiffuserRequest, which holds the following information: A list of class names representing the types of the formal parameters passed to the method. A list of byte[] representing the serialized parameter objects. The class name of the object containing the method to execute. A byte[] representing the serialized object containing the method to call. The name of the serializer used to serialize and deserialize (see the enum SerializerFactory.SerializerType) This is a non-blocking method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RestfulDiffuserManagerResource

        public RestfulDiffuserManagerResource(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executor,
                              ResultsCache resultsCache,
                              DiffuserLoadCalc loadCalc,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object[]> configurationClasses,
                              ClassLoaderFactory classLoaderFactory,
                              java.util.List<java.net.URL> classPaths)
        Constructs the basic diffuser manager resource that allows clients to interact with the diffuser created through this resource.
        Parameters:
        executor - The executor service to which tasks are submitted
        resultsCache - The cache holding the execution results in a ResultCacheEntry.
        loadCalc - The calculator that is used to calculate the load on this machine, and is used to determine whether the diffuser will execute the task locally or diffuse it to a remote diffuser.
        configurationClasses - A List of fully qualified class names. Each class should have methods annotated with DiffusiveServerConfiguration, which are called and used to configure this resource. These annotated methods should be static. Associated with each configuration class is an {@link Object}[] containing any arguments the configuration method may need.
        classLoaderFactory - The factory for creating class loaders needed for the diffusers. This allows using different class loaders for the server. For example, RestfulClassLoader for non-nested diffusion or a RestfulDiffuserClassLoader for nested diffusion.
        classPaths - holds a list of URL to JAR files that must be loaded in order to execute (see createJarClassPath(List) for a convenient method to create this list). diffuser methods, and that will get sent to other remote diffusers. The URL should point to a JAR file, and are likely to be a local path.
        Examples of paths passed to the createJarClassPath(List) method are:
        • ..\\examples\\example_0.2.0.jar (a relative path on Windows)
        • ../another/example.jar (a relative path on Windows, Unix/Linux, MacOSX)
        • C:/this/is/a/path/to/a/jar.jar (an absolute path on Windows)
        • C:\\this\\is\\another\\jar\\path\\example_0.2.0.jar (an absolute path on Windows)
        • /unix/type/jar/path/example.jar (an absolute path on Unix/Linux, MacOSX)
        • /Users/person/Documents/workspace/examples/example_0.2.0.jar (an absolute path on Unix/Linux, MacOSX)
        On Windows these will be translated to the form
        file:///C:/path/to/jar/file/example.jar
        and on Unix/Linux and MacOSX these will be translated to the form
        file:///path/to/jar/file/example.jar

    • Method Detail

      • createExecutorService

        public static final java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService createExecutorService(int numThreads)
        Creates a default ExecutorService (fixed thread pool) with the specified number of threads. The number of threads must be greater than 0.
        Parameters:
        numThreads - The number of threads (must be greater than 0)
        Returns:
        The newly create fixed thread pool ExecutorService.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a newly created FifoResultsCache
        See Also:
        FifoResultsCache

      • createLoadCalc

        public static final DiffuserLoadCalc createLoadCalc(ResultsCache cache)
        Creates a default DiffuserLoadCalc (TaskCpuLoadCalc) with the specified ResultsCache used to determine how many tasks are currently executing.
        Parameters:
        cache - The ResultsCache used to determine how many tasks are currently executing
        Returns:
        a newly created TaskCpuLoadCalc
        See Also:
        TaskCpuLoadCalc

      • createJarClassPath

        public static final java.util.List<java.net.URL> createJarClassPath(java.util.List<java.lang.String> jarPaths)
        Creates a list of absolute URL based on the (relative or absolute) paths to the additional jar files. For example, suppose that your current directory is /User/name/diffuser/Diffuser_Server_0.2.0/jars and you specify that the jar containing your code is in ../mycode/mycode_v2.jar relative to the directory from which the server is executed. Then this method would return a list containing the absolute path file:///User/name/diffuser/Diffuser_Server_0.2.0/mycode/mycode_v2.jar. Or if you specified an absolution path, then this method would return file:// prepended to your absolute path
        Parameters:
        jarPaths - The list of jar file paths.
        Returns:
        a list of absolute URL jar paths.
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException

      • create

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response create(@Context
                               javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                               CreateDiffuserRequest request)
        Creates a RestfulDiffuser using the information specified in the CreateDiffuserRequest object. The basic information needed by the diffusers is:
        • The Serializer used to serialize (marshal) and deserialize (unmarshal) the objects that get flung across the network.
        • Any additional end-points containing RestfulDiffusers to which the new RestfulDiffuser can diffuse method calls. The base endpoints are specified in the configuration.
        • The return type
        • The Class containing the diffused method.
        • The name of the diffused method
        • A list of argument types that represent the method's formal parameters.
        Parameters:
        uriInfo - Information about the request URI and the JAX-RS application.
        request - The request object containing the information needed to create a RestfulDiffuser.
        Returns:
        A response containing and Atom feed with information about the newly created diffuser. Specifically, it contains the URI of the newly created diffuser, the key, date created, and the URI representing the URI that resolved to this create method.

      • create

        private java.lang.String create(Serializer serializer,
                      java.util.List<java.net.URI> clientEndpoints,
                      java.util.List<java.net.URI> classPaths,
                      java.lang.String returnTypeClassName,
                      java.lang.String containingClassName,
                      java.lang.String methodName,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> argumentTypes)
        Creates the diffuser if it doesn't already exist and crafts the response. Decouples the way the information is sent from the creation of the diffuser and the response
        Parameters:
        serializer - The Serializer used to serialize/deserialize objects
        clientEndpoints - The URI of the end-points to which result requests can be sent
        classPaths - The URI of the end-points which can act as a class path. In other words, these end-points can return a Class object.
        returnTypeClassName - The class name of the returned type
        containingClassName - The name of the Class containing the method to execute
        methodName - The name of the method to execute
        argumentTypes - The parameter types (fully qualified class names) that form part of the method's signature
        Returns:
        The diffuser ID (signature) of the diffusive method associated with the newly created diffuser.

      • getDiffuser

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getDiffuser(@Context
                                    javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                    java.lang.String signature)
        Returns information about the diffuser represented by the specified signature.
        Parameters:
        uriInfo - Information about the request URI and the JAX-RS application.
        signature - The signature of the RestfulDiffuser corresponding to a specific method. The signatures are created using the DiffuserSignature class.
        Returns:
        A response containing the signature, and the URI of the diffuser with the specified signature.
        See Also:
        DiffuserSignature

      • execute

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response execute(@Context
                                javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                java.lang.String signature,
                                ExecuteDiffuserRequest request)
        Executes the diffuser associated with the specified signature (DiffuserSignature) using the information specified in the ExecuteDiffuserRequest, which holds the following information:
        • A list of class names representing the types of the formal parameters passed to the method.
        • A list of byte[] representing the serialized parameter objects.
        • The class name of the object containing the method to execute.
        • A byte[] representing the serialized object containing the method to call.
        • The name of the serializer used to serialize and deserialize (see the enum SerializerFactory.SerializerType)
        This is a non-blocking method. A reference to the result is placed in the results cache, and the status of the execution can be monitored with the #isRunning(String, String) method. The results can be obtained from the blocking getResult(UriInfo, String, String) method.
        Parameters:
        uriInfo - Information about the request URI and the JAX-RS application.
        signature - The signature of the RestfulDiffuser corresponding to a specific method. The signatures are created using the DiffuserSignature class.
        request - The ExecuteDiffuserRequest holding the serialized object and method parameters, the type information, and the Serializer name.
        Returns:
        A Response containing a string version of an Atom feed that holds the result ID and a link to the URI representing the result.
        See Also:
        #isRunning(String, String), getResult(UriInfo, String, String)

      • getClass

        private java.lang.Class<?> getClass(java.lang.String classname,
                          java.lang.String signature)
        Returns the Class for the specified name. The signature comes along for the ride, in case there is a problem loading the Class of the specified name.
        Parameters:
        classname - The name of the class to load
        signature - The signature of the diffusive method in case the Class of the specified name can't be loaded
        Returns:
        The Class associated with the specified class name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the class of the specified name can't be found

      • deserialize

        private <T> T deserialize(ExecuteDiffuserRequest request,
                java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Deserializes the object in the specified execute diffuser request and returns it. Uses the serializer and the class type specified in the request.
        Parameters:
        request - The execute diffuser request that holds the object
        signature - The signature of the diffused method
        Returns:
        The object deserialized from the specified request

      • getResultStatus

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getResultStatus(java.lang.String signature,
                                        java.lang.String resultId)
        Returns the status for the task for the specified result ID and signature
        Parameters:
        signature - The signature of the diffused method
        resultId - The ID associated with the result
        Returns:
        The status of the result. Returns "ok" if the result is done; "no content" otherwise

      • getResult

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getResult(@Context
                                  javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                  java.lang.String signature,
                                  java.lang.String requestId)
        Returns the result of execute(UriInfo, String, ExecuteDiffuserRequest) method call against a specific diffuser. The result is referenced through the result ID which was generated and passed back to the client when the execute(UriInfo, String, ExecuteDiffuserRequest) method was called. The result ID is created in the createResultsCacheId(String, String) based on the signature and the request ID.
        Parameters:
        uriInfo - Information about the request URI and the JAX-RS application.
        signature - The signature of the RestfulDiffuser corresponding to a specific method. The signatures are created using the DiffuserSignature class.
        requestId - The result ID corresponding to the result.
        Returns:
        An Response object that contains a string version of the Atom feed holding the result. The content of the Atom feed contains the byte[] version of the serialized result object.

      • getList

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getList(@Context
                                javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo)
        Returns an Atom feed as a string, whose entries each represent a registered diffuser
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • createResultsCacheId

        private static final java.lang.String createResultsCacheId(java.lang.String signature,
                                    java.lang.String requestId)
        Creates the results cache ID used as the key into the resultsCache.
        Parameters:
        signature - The signature of the method that was executed
        requestId - The request ID that was specified as part of the ExecuteDiffuserRequest
        Returns:
        The key for the resultsCache Map.

      • createResultsCacheId

        private static final java.lang.String createResultsCacheId(ResultId resultId)
        Constructs the results cache ID used as the key into the resultsCache. Returns the same value as a call to:

        ResultId.create( resultId.getSignature(), resultId.getRequestId() )

        Parameters:
        resultId - The ResultId object
        Returns:
        The key into the results cache.
